transcript.title: CHOGM
transcript.content:
I am pleased to announce today that Canberra is to be the Federal

Government's selection as the host city for the Commonwealth

Heads of Government Meeting (CHOGM) 2001.

It is appropriate that such a meeting be held in the national capital

at the centenary of our Federation.

Canberra is a capital city of which all Australians can be proud.

CHOGM will give Australia the chance to showcase its capital to leaders

from around the world.

The Federal Government's agreement is subject to being fully

satisfied that suitable accommodation and conference facilities are

available. We are working with the ACT Government on these matters

and are confident that these requirements can be met.

The meeting would represent significant opportunities for Canberra

businesses, particularly the hospitality and recreational sector.

This is especially the case as CHOGM will follow the Sydney 2000 Olympics.

The Federal Government looks forward to working with the ACT Government

in bringing this ambitious project to fruition.

19 February 1998
